medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced 5 hours of sharp right upper quadrant pain starting 2 hours after eating, which progressed to dull pain. She has had 3 prior episodes of biliary colic, each resolving within 2 hours. This time, the pain persisted as dull, accompanied by low grade temperatures, chills, malaise, nausea, dry heaving, and lack of oral intake. She denied diarrhea and dysuria but mentioned possible blood-tinged urine.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1.2-cm grade 1 infiltrating carcinoma of right breast s/p surgery and XRT, tooth abscess, goiter, Ludwig's angina, hypertension.
